TEI.2.document_title: H. Meigs to Stephen F Austin, 05-30-1834

barker_notes.barker_summary: H. Meigs to Austin, New York, May 30, 1834. Inclosing letter from Louis McLane showing that United States has intervened in Austin's behalf.
barker_notes.barker_footnotes: Meigs was Forsyth's brother-in-law. He connected with Austin through his wife, the daughter of Austin's Uncle Stephen.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1056-1057

*div1 type="summary"* *p*H. Meigs to Austin, New York, May 30, 1834. Inclosing letter from Louis McLane showing that United States has intervened in Austin's behalf.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*New York*/location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="05-30-1834"> May 30 1834.*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear Sir*/p*
*p*The moment I learned that your safety was threatened by the *person_mentioned*Government of *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, I endeavored to procure the interference of our *person_mentioned*Government */person_mentioned*in your behalf. You will see by the inclosed note from the *person_mentioned*Secretary of State*/person_mentioned* and the brief indorsement by my brother *person_mentioned*Forsyth */person_mentioned*that such interference was made*/p*.
*p*I wrote to you several months ago—I wish that you would answer that Letter—and favorably too. Long life and prosperity to you.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned* H Meigs*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col. Stephen Austin*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Colonel Stephen Austin */person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin Texas*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Inclosure]*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Department of State*/location_mentioned**/p* *p**location_mentioned*Washington*/location_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="05-26-1834">26th May, 1834*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p*The *person_mentioned*Honorable John Forsythe, Senator of the United States*/person_mentioned*.*/p* *p*Sir:*/p*
*p*I have the honor to inform you that in compliance with the request in your letter to me of the *date_mentioned n="05-19-1834">19th instant*/date_mentioned*, an instruction of the character suggested by you has been addressed to our *person_mentioned*diplomatic representative at *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*. I am, respectfully,*/p*
*p*Your obedient servant,*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Louis McLane*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*The answer to my letter asking interference for your friend *person_mentioned*Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Forsyth*/person_mentioned*.*/p* *p*[Indorsed:] *person_mentioned*H. Meigs*/person_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1834">1834*/date_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
